intro: Peltaea stellata, commonly known as the star-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves and bell-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to blue, bloom in the summer months. Peltaea stellata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable conditions.
